normalised: **Social Media and Influencer Marketing: Follower Analytics**

unnormalised: Hey Insta fam! Want to *really* know what's happening with your followers, beyond just the likes? Forget just posting that Diwali reel and hoping for the best. We're talking DEEP dive into follower analytics!
normalised: Hey Insta fam! Want to *really* know what is happening with your followers, beyond just the likes? Forget just posting that Diwali reel and hoping for the best. We are talking deep dive into follower analytics!

unnormalised: New tools are popping up like Mumbai street food stalls, promising insights into who's *actually* vibing with your content. Imagine knowing exactly which age group in Delhi loves your travel pics, or which segment in Chennai can't get enough of your chai recipes.
normalised: New tools are popping up like Mumbai street food stalls, promising insights into who is *actually* vibing with your content. Imagine knowing exactly which age group in Delhi loves your travel pics, or which segment in Chennai cannot get enough of your chai recipes.

unnormalised: Turns out, those "Rs. 999" courses actually do teach you how to use these tools. Apparently, they can show you the best time to post (like 14:30 hrs for maximum engagement!) and even if your followers are legit or bought (ouch!).
normalised: Turns out, those "rupees nine hundred and ninety nine" courses actually do teach you how to use these tools. Apparently, they can show you the best time to post (like two thirty P M for maximum engagement!) and even if your followers are legit or bought (ouch!).

unnormalised: Some influencers are even using it to track competitor activity - think, what worked for Priya's saree haul on 26/01/2023 that you can apply to your own. So, before you plan your next campaign, spend time understanding your audience through analytics. It's like getting the cheat sheet to acing that IIT entrance exam but for social media, before the final date on 31/12/2024. You'll thank us later, promise!
normalised: Some influencers are even using it to track competitor activity - think, what worked for Priya's saree haul on twenty sixth january two thousand and twenty three that you can apply to your own. So, before you plan your next campaign, spend time understanding your audience through analytics.
